Thus, patients with anti-TNF-alpha-resistant CD may respond to this treatment option.

name: caspase recruitment domain family member 8
other_names: tumor up-regulated CARD-containing antagonist of CASP9
tumor up-regulated CARD-containing antagonist of caspase nine

kegg.name: NOD-like receptor signaling pathway - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: The protein encoded by this gene belongs to the caspase recruitment domain (CARD)-containing family of proteins, which are involved in pathways leading to activation of caspases or nuclear factor kappa-B (NFKB). This protein may be a component of the inflammasome, a protein complex that plays a role in the activation of proinflammatory caspases. It is thought that this protein acts as an adaptor molecule that negatively regulates NFKB activation, CASP1-dependent IL1B secretion, and apoptosis. Polymorphisms in this gene may be associated with a susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2010].
